subject: Climate & Environment
title: Hailstorms and Supercells
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Hailstorms and Supercells.

hook.text: The largest hailstone ever recorded was the size of a volleyball â€” 20 cm across.

buildup.text: Hail forms when powerful updrafts in supercells carry raindrops high enough to freeze.

discovery.text: Stones cycle up and down inside the storm, adding layers of ice until they're too heavy to float.

twist.text: A single hailstorm in 2022 caused $2.5 billion in damage in France in under an hour.

climax.text: Climate change may increase hail intensity. Warmer air holds more moisture for storms to use.

punchline.text: The sky can throw rocks. And they're getting bigger.

quiz.question: How does hail form inside a thunderstorm?
options: Updrafts carry raindrops high enough to freeze repeatedly
Rain freezes as it falls through cold air
Ice crystals form directly from water vapor
